long_desc.thetext:
The R4E feature needs to be adjusted so the minimum functionality needed is available e.g. This means that the Mylyn versions git feature must be included as optional within the R4E feature,
The notifications plug-in and SMTP mail connector may be bundled together in the same feature.
This is opened for discussion.

Reference to detailed input and experience sharing from Steffen
http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/mylyn-reviews-dev/msg00419.html

The suggestion from Steffen above was taken with the addition of the following bundles to the R4E and Reviews SDK feature projects. * import bundle javax.mail. * import bundle javax.activation
as well as the addition of EMF and Egit features to the R4E Feature (as require/import)
The pending question is how to make it intuitive for the users to install the Git UI Connector specially now that R4E supports only one Mylyn versions connector (git)

The missing part is to divide the features further e.g. separate in its own features: Birt reports Ldap Smtp mailing
However the site structure is shared between Task reviews, Gerrit connector and R4E. There is a need to define a structure so the context of each of the above features is clear. see: http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/mylyn-reviews-dev/msg00488.html
Birt separated to its own feature. No immediate need to separate Ldap and SMTP.
